title: How to insert the drop location symbol in Microsoft Word - Quora

response.answer_text: One of the best ways might be to visit: Marker, pin, position, navigation, location, Maps And Flags (at ShareIcon.Net)And copy the ‘FREE’ “…drop location symbol” of your choice as I did in the sample and paste it into Word (See ‘A’ below). For the purposes of this sample I set the graphic and the text box below with a right-click on each object an then choose [Wrap Text] → [In Line with Text]. A much harder way to do it inside Word (See ‘B’) is to invert a tear-drop symbol inside word. To do that you need to: Start by inserting a text box where you want to insert the character (See ‘B’)Leave Word’s cursor inside that text box.Go to the [Insert] menu at ‘C’.Select Symbol at ‘D’ and ‘E’ to get the Symbol window.In the Symbol window, select the desired ‘Wingdings’ [Font] at ‘F’.Find and click on the desired symbol. (In this case the ‘tear-drop’ symbol at ‘G’.)Press [Insert] at ‘H’ and then [Close]Rotate the text box 180 degrees to turn the tear -drop into a drop location (‘See ‘B’) and set to [In Line with Text] as above.
